prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 3mm scan - setup 1
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: 1st frequency setup of the band 3 scan in the UDF.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Molecular band 3 scan in the UDF. This is setup 1 out of 5.
We here chose to setup the scan manually in precisely the same way as the option ‘spectral scan’ does. The reason we chose to do this manually is due to non-optimal derivation of the overheads when using the ’spectral scan’ option for this project in the OT. We have discussed this issue through a helpdesk interaction with the ALMA team (#4587).
Sensitvity: We request a sensitivity of 0.075 mJy per 300 km/s channel to reach our science goals (i.e. reach a 5 sigma flux sensitivity of 0.11 Jy km/s, as discussed in the main proposal).
Imaging: In this molecular deep field we do not plan to resolve the galaxies, so observations in array C34-2 would be ideal (leading to a resolution of 2”, so still giving enough independent beams for stacking over the FOV), however C34-3 would also be acceptable (beam size of 1.4”).
Correlator setup: For this ‘manual’ setup of the spectral scan we use precisely the same central frequencies as the OT choses in the ‘spectral scan’ mode. We here request spectral averaging of ‘8’ which will still lead to high spectral resolution (~10 km/s) and thus open up the possibility of serendipitous line detections of face-on, low-mass galaxies.
Calibration: Default calibration is requested
Bandpass accuracy: No special accuracy requested
Data rate: Our data rate is below the expected average rate of 6 MB/s

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: 2nd frequency setup of the band 3 scan in the UDF.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: See setup 1. This is setup 2 out of 5.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 3mm scan - setup 5
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: 5th frequency setup of the band 3 scan in the UDF.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: See setup 1. This is setup 5 out of 5.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: To date, our understanding of the molecular gas content in high-redshift galaxies is fundamentally limited by pre-selection of the galaxies at other wavelengths (optical/NIR/IR, sub-millimeter, radio). To overcome this, we propose an unbiased molecular deep field (CO spectral scan of band 3, covering all z>1) in the Hubble Ultra Deep Field. We will reach a molecular mass limit that is an order of magnitude deeper than previously possible, below the expected 'knee' of the CO luminosity function. We expect to detect >20 galaxies (both in line and continuum) and these detections will be compared to (1) our detailed SED modeling of all galaxies in the UDF (2) our analytic-empirical models that build on our current understanding of high-redshift molecular gas and (3) the latest adaptive moving mesh cosmological hydrodynamic simulations that include molecular gas. Stacking (both 2D and 3D) will push the statistical detection of sources to unprecedented depths. In summary, we will put unbiased observational constraints on the redshift-dependent CO luminosity function and meaningfully constrain the cosmic evolution of the universal molecular gas density for the first time.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
